hanzi-su-wiki:
賞

Значения

Хвалить, восхищаться; ценить, восхищаться; премия

Мнемоника

Хвалить и награждать деньгами 貝 в торжественной обстановке 尚.

Варианты

赏
purpleculture_pinyin:
shǎng
to bestow (a reward); to give (to an inferior); to hand down; a reward (bestowed by a superior); to appreciate (beauty)
дарить (награда); отдавать (низшему); передать; награда (дается вышестоящим); ценить (красоту)
rtega_mnemonic:
賞賞RS
赏赏		reward, grant, prize, bestow, appreciate
  • money 貝 given to show respect 尚 to somebody
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 赏)
Antonyms: 罰
Pictophonetic: 尚 indicates the sound; 贝 (money) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 賞賜 [ shǎng cì ]: to bestow; to confer (a reward for service); a reward
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 尚 [ shàng ] still, yet; even; fairly, rather
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
heisig_chinese_memo: You won first prize in a shellfish eating contest. Unfortunately you spent the whole night in the outhouse after.
heisig_constituent: prize, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
koohiiStory1: This is a bit silly.. or maybe not only a bit, but.. You know some foodstuffs (cereals come to mind) sometimes have prizes mixed in them? Well, in this case, the prize was a shell (money, remember) and you only notice in the outhouse... (see also secret (#904)).
koohiiStory2: As a prize for being the 1,000,000th person to use the restaurant´s outhouse, I got all the clams I could eat.
jp_example_words:
懸賞(けんしょう): offering prizes, winning, reward
入賞(にゅうしょう): winning a prize or place (in a contest)
鑑賞(かんしょう): appreciation
賞(しょう): prize, award
賞金(しょうきん): prize, monetary award
賞品(しょうひん): prize, trophy
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Shoot a shellfish that's in the mouth of a Viking at the fair and you'll win a prize. The game is to shoot the shellfish in the Viking's mouth and knock it over.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine looking at a big Viking with a shellfish in its mouth. You want to knock it over. You want this prize.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The prize you're working so hard to win is lunch with the Shougun (しょう). This is a pretty huge prize, considering all you're doing is knocking something over.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You want this prize. You want to meet the Shougun. Soon you'll both be eating shellfish together!
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 冖 (ва), 口 (рот), 尚 (ещё), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese: shǎng: (глаг/сущ) награждать; любоваться, наслаждаться; ценить, почитать; удостаивать своим присутствием; награда
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the employee (員) in the classroom (龸) gets the prize
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The shellfish in the outhouse won the prize for longest number 2 in history.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: In the bronze inscription, the word reward is written as " shang " at the end of the week and the beginning of the week, followed by the symbol " bei " to show the gift of wealth, and the word " reward " in the Eastern Zhou Dynasty. The " compensation " of repayment was written as " reward " in the Western Zhou Dynasty, and this word was not seen in the early Eastern Zhou Dynasty. Shuihudi simple word for " reward " the reward of " reward " the same shape. Hu Ding " reward " from the word " still " provincial sound, Wang Zhongshan side pot " Tony " save as " head " shape. "Shuowen": "Reward, give merit. Congbei, Shangsheng." See " Shang ".

Bronze inscription refers to rewards, 𠫑Qiang Zhong: "Reward to Han Zong" refers to the reward of Han Zong. King Zhongshan Fanghu: "The emperor does not forget his honor, and [辶吏] his old strategy rewards Zhong (Zhong) father", which means that the emperor has not forgotten his meritorious service, so that the elderly ministers will give Zhongfu's merits and rewards. On the bamboo slips. It is also used as " compensation ", which means compensation. Jian Ding: "Reward (compensate) Jianhe Shizi." On the other hand, Jianding: "Reward (compensation) in the coming year, then double", indicating that if there is no compensation in the next year, The penalty is doubled.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period refer to rewards, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 43: "His politics does not reward, and officials do not rely on nominations." This means that his politics is clear and does not rely on rewards, and his ministers do their duties without indiscriminately giving titles. Also "Shangbo Bamboo Book IV. "Cao Mozhichen" Jane 35-36: "Appreciate the sound (listen), then the people will be in harmony", which means to reward fairness, listen to just words, then the people will live in harmony with the master.

Qin Jian refers to rewards, "Qin Jian in Sleeping Tiger Land. "Law Questions and Answers" Jan 52: "Broad (expand) the hearts of the people, and those who hear the left and right, reward." The full sentence refers to those who can inspire the people and make the right and left hear his reputation should be rewarded. The word is also used as " compensation ", referring to compensation, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "The Eighteen Kinds of Qin Laws" Jian 76: "Public responsibility (debt) the people have not rewarded (paid), also moved to the county, the county rewards (paid)", refers to the government owes the people's debt and has not repaid, and should also issue a document to the people Counties, repaid by the county. The other word is also used for " taste ", referring to the past, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Japanese Book A Type" Jane 143zheng-4: "Ding Wei gave birth to a son, not lucky, not a (no) mother, he must reward (taste) a prisoner."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions often start with the sound of " Bei " and " Shang ". In ancient times, " reward " and " shang " were the same word. It should be under the guise of " shang " as " reward ", followed by " bei " to differentiate " reward ", the purpose is to highlight the " reward " related to the gift of goods. The original meaning is to give.
humanum_full_description:
金文中，賞賜字商末周初作「商」，後加形符「貝」以示財貨的賜予，入東周則字多作「賞」。償還之「償」西周寫作「賞」，東周早期未見此字。睡虎地秦簡字作「賞」，與賞賜之「賞」同形。曶鼎「賞」字從「尚」省聲，中山王方壺「貝」省作「目」形。《說文》：「賞，賜有功也。从貝，尚聲。」參見「商」。

　　金文指賞賜，𠫑羌鐘：「賞于韓宗」，指得到韓宗的賞賜。中山王方壺：「天子不忘其有勛，[辶吏]其老策賞中(仲)父」，意謂天子沒有忘記他有功勳，使年老的大臣把仲父的功勞與賞賜書於竹簡上。又用作「償」，指賠償的意思，曶鼎：「賞(償)曶禾十秭。」另，曶鼎：「來歲弗賞(償)，則倍」，指明年不賠償的話，則刑罰加倍。

　　戰國竹簡指賞賜，《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡43：「其政治而不賞，官而不爵」，指他的政治清明而不靠賞賜，臣下盡職而不濫賜爵位。又《上博竹書四．曹沫之陳》簡35-36：「賞均聲(聽)中，則民和之」，意謂獎賞公平，聽信公正的言語，那麼人民就會與長上和睦相處。

　　秦簡指賞賜，《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》簡52：「廣(擴)眾心，聲聞左右者，賞。」全句指能振奮眾人士氣，使左右聽聞他的名聲的，應予賞賜。字又用作「償」，指賠償，《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》簡76：「公有責(債)百姓未賞(償)，亦移其縣，縣賞(償)」，指官府欠百姓債而未償還，亦應發文書給百姓所在的縣，由該縣償還。另字又用作「嘗」，指曾經，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡143正-4：「丁未生子，不吉，毋(無)母，必賞(嘗)繫囚。」
humanum_short_description: 金文多從「貝」，「商」聲。古代「賞」、「商」本同一字，應是假借「商」作「賞」，後加「貝」分化出「賞」，目的是突出「賞」涉及財貨的賜予。本義是賜予。

shang3
HSK 1: 上
HSK 5: 赏,賞
賞賞RS
赏赏 		reward, grant, prize, bestow, appreciate
  • money 貝 given to show respect 尚 to somebody
(Simplified: 赏)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 罰
Pictophonetic: 尚 indicates the sound; 贝 (money) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 尚 [ shàng ] still, yet; even; fairly, rather
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
①指地位高的人或長輩給地位低的人或晚輩財物：賞金。賞賜。獎賞。賞罰分明。
②因愛好某種東西而觀看：賞閱。賞析。賞花。賞月。欣賞。鑑賞。賞心悅目。
③認識到人的才能或作品的價值而給予重視：賞識。讚賞。
④敬辭：賞臉。賞光。
⑤姓氏。
⑥古同“尚”，尊重。
賞賜 [ shǎng cì ]: to bestow; to confer (a reward for service); a reward
(Simplified: 赏)

Pictophonetic: 尚 indicates the sound; 贝 (money) conveys the meaning.

金文中，賞賜字商末周初作「 商 」，後加形符「 貝 」以示財貨的賜予，入東周則字多作「 賞 」。償還之「 償 」西周寫作「 賞 」，東周早期未見此字。睡虎地秦簡字作「 賞 」，與賞賜之「 賞 」同形。曶鼎「 賞 」字從「 尚 」省聲，中山王方壺「 貝 」省作「 目 」形。《說文》：「賞，賜有功也。从貝，尚聲。」參見「 商 」。 金文指賞賜，𠫑羌鐘：「賞于韓宗」，指得到韓宗的賞賜。中山王方壺：「天子不忘其有勛，[辶吏]其老策賞中(仲)父」，意謂天子沒有忘記他有功勳，使年老的大臣把仲父的功勞與賞賜書於竹簡上。又用作「 償 」，指賠償的意思，曶鼎：「賞(償)曶禾十秭。」另，曶鼎：「來歲弗賞(償)，則倍」，指明年不賠償的話，則刑罰加倍。 戰國竹簡指賞賜，《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡43：「其政治而不賞，官而不爵」，指他的政治清明而不靠賞賜，臣下盡職而不濫賜爵位。又《上博竹書四．曹沫之陳》簡35-36：「賞均聲(聽)中，則民和之」，意謂獎賞公平，聽信公正的言語，那麼人民就會與長上和睦相處。 秦簡指賞賜，《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》簡52：「廣(擴)眾心，聲聞左右者，賞。」全句指能振奮眾人士氣，使左右聽聞他的名聲的，應予賞賜。字又用作「 償 」，指賠償，《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》簡76：「公有責(債)百姓未賞(償)，亦移其縣，縣賞(償)」，指官府欠百姓債而未償還，亦應發文書給百姓所在的縣，由該縣償還。另字又用作「 嘗 」，指曾經，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡143正-4：「丁未生子，不吉，毋(無)母，必賞(嘗)繫囚。」

賞字的基本解释

賞
shǎng
见“赏”。

賞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shǎng］
［《廣韻》書兩切，上養，書。］
“赏1”的繁体字。
(1)赏赐，奖赏。
(2)赏赐或奖给的财物。
(3)赠送；赠给。
(4)褒扬，赞赏。
(5)玩赏；欣赏。
(6)劝告。
(7)敬称人加惠于己之词。
(8)土地面积单位。
(9)通“償”。酬报。
(10)通“尚”。参见“賞賢使能”。
(11)通“嘗”。参见“賞新”。
(12)姓。三国吴有赏林。见《三国志·吴志·孙休传》。

賞字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　賞； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1209第19
【廣韻】書兩切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】始兩切，?音曏。【說文】賜有功也。【書·大禹謨】賞延于世。又【仲虺之誥】功懋懋賞。【周禮·天官·大宰】三載，則計羣吏之治而誅賞之。　又【戰國策】故賞韓王，以近河外。【註】賞，猶勸也。　又【類篇】一曰玩也，嘉也。【陶潛·移居詩】奇文共欣賞。　又凡貽與者亦曰賞。【柳宗元·送薛存義序】于其往也，賞以酒肉，重之以辭。　又姓。【姓纂】晉人賞慶，註《周易》。

賞字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
賞字的起名意思

暂无。

reward

reward
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shǎng］
[The book of "Guangyun" has two cuts, upper support, book. ]
The traditional characters of "赏1".
(1) Rewards, rewards.
(2) Rewards or rewards.
(3) Give; give to.
(4) Praise and praise.
(5) Play and appreciate;
(6) Advise.
(7) Words that honor people and benefit oneself.
(8) Land area unit.
(9) Through "compensation". reward.
(10) Through "Shang". See "Reward and Enabling".
(11) Through "taste". See "Rewarding New".
(12) Last name. Three Kingdoms Wu has to appreciate the forest. See "Three Kingdoms·Wu Zhi·Sun Xiu Biography".
reward
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] 　赏; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1209 Page 19
[Guang Yun] Book in two cuts [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] at the beginning of two cuts,? Sound. [Said the text] Give meritorious service too. 【Book·Da Yumo】Appreciation extends to the world. Also 【Zhong Zhuo Zhi】Gong Mao rewards. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Da Zai】Three years, then he will be rewarded by the rule of the group of officials.　[Warring States Policy] So reward the King of Han, near Hewai. [Note] Reward, still persuade.　[Classes] One more talk about playing, Jiaye. 【Tao Qian·Immigrating Poems】Appreciate the strange writings.　Everyone who yells with each other is also said to be rewarded. [Preface to Liu Zongyuan·Send Xue Cunyi] In his destiny, enjoy the wine and meat, and the important words.　Another last name. [Surname Compilation] Jin people appreciate the celebration, note "Zhou Yi".

Name meaning

shǎng
вм. 赏
Radicals: 口, 貝  (mouth, shellfish, viking)
Meaning Mnemonic
Shoot a shellfish that's in the mouth of a Viking at the fair and you'll win a prize. The game is to shoot the shellfish in the Viking's mouth and knock it over.
Imagine looking at a big Viking with a shellfish in its mouth. You want to knock it over. You want this prize.
Reading Mnemonic
The prize you're working so hard to win is lunch with the Shougun (しょう). This is a pretty huge prize, considering all you're doing is knocking something over.
You want this prize. You want to meet the Shougun. Soon you'll both be eating shellfish together!
